oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slave bill of sale from Fayette County, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. William J. Cannon of Hatchie Hall Plantation in Fayette County, Tenn. purchased 2 slaves from Atlas J. Peebles for the sum of $1750, a man named Leannie, aged 70, and another named Ben, aged 41. The document stated that were both "healthy, sensible and slaves for life." Such a high price for relatively aged slaves may indicate that they were craftsmen, mechanics or had some other unusual skill.
